intro: Platysace haplosciadia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late summer. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. The species is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, making it a common component of dryland vegetation.
